intro: Murdannia sinica, commonly known as Chinese mouse-ear, is a herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are usually greenish-white with three petals. Murdannia sinica is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
